description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6s5da","text":"This is a gene discovery protocol utilising a single seed gene to create correlation lists. These lists are used to identify novel genes in rare diseases.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Test for robustness","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9jdl5","text":"\u003edata \u003c- as.matrix(read.table(\"GSE2109_rho_34_CLEAN.txt\",\nheader=TRUE,row.names=1))","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b7jr0","text":"\u003erobustness \u003c- pvclust((as.matrix(t(data))),method.dist=\"correlation\", use.cor=\"pairwise.complete.obs\", method.hclust=\"ward.D2\",nboot=1000)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6otng","text":"\u003eplot(robustness, hang=-1,cex=0.5, main=\"GSE2109 Correlation (|ρ|≥0.34) Cluster with\np-values (%)\")","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3le0d","text":"\u003epvrect(result,alpha=0.95)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3f2tp","text":"Enter all positive and negative correlation gene lists into Enrichr (maayanlab.cloud), and for each list:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"btmcn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"241j7","text":"1. In the Diseases / Drugs tab select Orphanet Augmented 2021","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47cb4","text":"2. Copy all significant disorders Name and Adjusted P-value into a spreadsheet. Positive lists gene overlap must contain SOD3 and at two other genes, whereas negative correlation lists do not have to have SOD3 as an overlap gene but must contain 3 list genes in the overlap (hover over the disorder to check)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gboj","text":"3. Identify minimum viable positive and negative lists (i.e. the smallest signed gene lists which have a significant overlap with disorder(s)).    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"589oi","text":"4. Delete from the spreadsheet any disorders from parent lists not in the minimum viable positive and negative lists","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq3mr","text":"5. Identify the gene lists with the greatest overlap and associate the disorder to that list, noting the overlap genes in the spreadsheet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48vqt","text":"6. Cross reference the Orphanet disorder names (Orphanet: Search by disease name) with the OMIM names (Home - OMIM) noting the causal genes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":32},{"key":2,"offset":103,"length":11}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D5D03320C6C511EEB7180A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://maayanlab.cloud/Enrichr"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FAD6C44FC6C911EEB7180A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.orpha.net/consor/cgi-bin/Disease_Search_Simple.php?lng=EN"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"112C91A7C6CA11EEB7180A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.omim.org"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tqia","text":"Individually enter each gene list associated with a disorder into Enrichr (maayanlab.cloud) and add the causal gene(s) for the disorder considered.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"b6c4l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"citmd","text":"1. In the pathways tab, use Elsevier Pathway Collection, from the table note the significant pathways and the adjusted p-value of any pathways containing both a causal gene and a non-overlapping list gene","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u8l4","text":"2. In the ontologies tab note from the Biological Process, Molecular Function, and Human Phenotype tables significant entries and adjusted p-values of any entries containing both a causal gene and a non-overlapping list gene","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgp4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqc1g","text":"Associate qualifying entries with the list associated disorders","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vdc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbncs","text":"Note the non-overlapping gene(s) (potentially novel genes) linked to the disorders via the causal gene/list ontologies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B1C8A799C6D111EEB7180A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://maayanlab.cloud/Enrichr"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ghft","text":"Search the literature for previous works which may lead to potential mechanisms or pathways from the potentially novel genes to disorder presentation. Repeat for superoxide dismutase, superoxide, and hydrogen peroxide. Consider gene aliases / previous symbols in respect of time allocated to the research","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
